result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard P Gissal was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early discharge of probation upon the successful completion of the Waushara County TAD program.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file in the amount of $1200.00 be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Subject to the Court's authority under 973.03(4)(a) for the sentence to be served under EMD with house arrest, subject to jail rules, with Good Time Credit.  48 hour rule.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 11:23 am case called. Defendant Richard P Gissal in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court accepts plea of No Contest and enters JOC. DRI-14TR78. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period 24 months. Subject to petition for discharge for completion of the TAD program. CONDITIONS: 6 months WCJ subject to the court's authority under 973.03(4)(a)-be served under EMD with house arrest, per jail rules, with Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day served. 24 mo DL revocation nunc pro tunc to February 25, 2015. Revocation retroactive to 2/25/15 for the defendant benefit of Occ DL w/in 45 days, 24 mo IID nunc pro tunc to May 22, 2015 as defendant has had the IID installed since that date.  $2000 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan-bond to be applied.  Participation and completion of TAD, AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing at 06-23-2015 11:30 am

Case Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Richard P Gissal in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reconvenes in aftermath of Def's arrangements being made for reporting.  DA requests which offer Def will be accepted.  Per Atty Singh:  Def wishing to accept TAD Court option.  Arrangements made with WC Jail.  Def is suffering IID malfunctions the last few days.  TAD Coordinator joins hearing - assessment not yet completed.  Def was not aware that assessment needed to be completed prior to acceptance.  Upon initial review, Court believes Def would be a strong candidate for TAD Court.  The Court:  Due to problems with IID malfunctions and Assessment process sentencing adjourned for today.   DA states for the record and clarification made of offer extended and min/mandatory requirement as per statute.  Def will be afforded GT credit due to min/mandatory.  Court explains authority to order min/mandatory with consideration for entering TAD Court.  Court will have authority to order EMD.  SEH rescheduled. NOH Given.  Def reminded that bond continues to be in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Order for IID Exemption
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-29-2015 03:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-15-2015 01:30 pm

Case called @ 3:52 p.m. Defendant Richard P Gissal in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by DA Blader. The parties are requesting the the plea be entered today with no JOC being entered at this time. SEH to be withheld until a later date.  DE also may be interested in participating in the TAD program which is an option that needs time to be explored. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea but does not enter JOC at this time. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. The court will adjourn the matter for sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-24-2015 04:00 pm

7:58 am case called. Attorney Sarvan Singh in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding status of matter. Attorney Singh states his client is ready to enter a plea. Court will hold hearing on Wednesday February 25, 2015 at 4:00 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Case called @ 4:20 p.m. Attorney Sarvan Singh in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury trial scheduled for 2/26/15.  DA Blader - has had discussions with Atty Singh and there may be possible resolution. DE has concerns however with the 45 day waiting period on the revocation. Statement by Atty Singh - statements by Blader are correct. Atty Singh requesting that a plea hearing be held with the finding of guilt being withheld until sentencing. The Court questions Atty Singh about probation as a possible resolution. Atty Singh will discuss the possibility of probation with the defendant. The court would like a TSCN 2/24.  Telephone conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 07:55 am.
Motion Hearing - August 29, 2014

12:30 pm case called. Defendant Richard P Gissal in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding status. No objection to State's Motion in Limine. Statement by Attorney Singh. Agreement for 906.09 motion-Court permits impeachment if defendant elects to testify-correct answer for convictions would be two. Motions brought by State are proper and are granted by Court. Sequestration order would be granted. Defense Motion in Limine addressed. Court grants defense motions, save the impeachment issue previously addressed. Jury instructions addressed. Discussion between court and counsel. Court accpets "Old Chief" stipulation entered between parties-discussion with defendant by Court. Court will impanel 23, 5 strikes each side.  Final Offer stated on record-defendant wishes to decline offer.

Case Called @ 3:24 PM: Defendant Richard P Gissal in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Record was made at Pre-Lim Hrg for purposes of motion today.  Atty Singh:  Requests to cross examine witness as to credibility issues.  Dep. Scott Eagan sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.  Record to reflect positive ID of Def by witness.  Cross Exam by Atty Singh.  Argument by DA.  Argument by Atty Singh.  The Court:  Finds reasonable suspicion occurred - series of events give rise to reasonable suspicion. With stated body of knowledge - finds stop was justified.   Finds no law enforcement malfeasance.  State has established that this stop took place under reasonable suspicion.  Respectfully denies motion to suppress.  Per Atty Singh - possible Klessig/Ernst issues need to be explored.  DA has obtained a transcript from the State of Michigan.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Motion hearing on August 29, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m.  Defendant Richard P Gissal in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not qualify for SPD services.
